comments.commentBody:
Whatever. Jason Chaffetz has better things to do. Have you heard that the National Park Service may have gotten premature notice of a national monument investigation? And how about Devin Nunes? When he's not cleaning his $50 K Trump fundraiser plate, he's too busy figuring out ways to divert DoD monies to the Azores.

What's Russia to a crack team of patriotic sleuths like those nimrods?

Instead of publishing inuendo, why don't you publish something of fact?!

A line in your very first sentence - "...about possible contacts between associates of President-elect Donald J. Trump and Russians" - illustrates the point. There was either contact or there wasn't. And, if there was contact then the substance of those conversations must've been recorded, so those feeding the NY Times with these hints of treason on the part of Trump's team should know EXACTLY what was said.

Please, for the sake of stability in the Western world, publish EVERYTHING you know to be fact and avoid all of this speculation. You're undermining the very system you, as a newspaper, claim to believe in.

replies.commentBody:
"regardless of what the facts are."

Thanks to Rohit for reminding us of our so-called president's personal credo.

Look, if it isn't one thing it's the other. Not a citizen...secret Muslim...started Isis..etc.

No matter the reality, the right wing will continue to pump out garbage because they know there's a solid base of true believers out there.
Interesting that, like most our our current President's supporters, you make up "facts" to fit your argument.

comments.commentBody: This is likely to be used as "Proof" that Obama is secretly trying to undermine the new Administration- a popular conspiracy theory on the right-wing blogs and radio programs.

So we have evidence that Trump lied about his connections to Russia. And Congress isn't acting on this... why?

Oh right. The GOP is too craven and power hungry to care that Trump is compromised.
Please keep reporting NYT!  Thank you!

replies.commentBody: Just by looking at one picture that I could tell it was all a good act; he had been extensively counseled on how to speak politely to the American public… Nothing more than the funny that he is
Fingers crossed
How sedated do you think he was? Same lies, just no red face, twitching, wild gesticulating, or spittle forming on his lips like usual.

comments.commentBody: The calm, steady Trump we witnessed last night during is about to implode and get all twittery tonight.

replies.commentBody: The country lost, and you don't care. Sad.

comments.commentBody: You lost, get over it. Nothing is going to change except for the Supreme Court.
So, who are the next Woodward and Bernstein out there to pick up the trail? Get after it!
Here's hoping that this boomerangs on these partisan dems and that someone like Brennan winds up in a legal bind.

replies.commentBody: @Chris Miilu:  With Obama's lack of action while he was POTUS moving back to the streets would be a step up from the alley Obama operated from.
Don't remember the exact words, but he did when he spoke of how countries that were once adversaries/enemies would be come our friends.

comments.commentBody:
So where does this leave us now?

President Trump did not mention one iota of issues/concerns in his speech yesterday about Russia and it appears that the GOP wants to sweep this under the rug.

It makes me wonder what would have happened if this would have been brought to the forefront before the election was held. I guess we will never really know.

replies.commentBody: Well, we get Pence.  Evil but not mentally deranged.
Leading Edge Boomer - Do you really think Pence didn't know about any of this?

comments.commentBody:
....and the plot thickens!

But, what will really happen if it is proven fact that Trump and Putin knowingly meddled in the election?

Impeachment? What are we going to do with rest of Trump's Cabinet?

Why do I feel this will be billed as
1) as fake news
2) a coordinated effort of Obama's administration to 'frame' the new administration
Sadly, I fear a frightening percentage of our country's population will dismiss this- even if the ties and collusion to the Trump campaign , and Trump himself. are without doubt.

replies.commentBody:
" Our intelligence agencies may be the bulwark in opposition to our democracy being subsumed by the infection which is Putin's Russia."

The frightening and sad state of affairs in America today is to think intelligence agencies are the main line of defense of democracy. Intelligence agencies are neither democratic nor sources of truth. They are the creators of fake news.

It is certainly telling that the Obama Administration was competent enough to:

1. Detect that the Trump Administration might well be compromised, and fail to execute their duties w/r/t investigation and corrective actions.

2. Anticipate a cover-up.

3. Preserve the facts in a way which would prevent a cover-up attempt from being successful.

4. Allow the Trump Administration to implicate itself by attempting to cover up the facts of the pervasive contacts with high-level Russian oligarchs and politicians, and very likely intelligence operatives (whether knowingly or not).

This Obama operation can be considered a sting of global proportions. Congratulations, Mr President, and all of the dedicated professionals who contributed to this valiant effort to defend our democracy, and democracy as a method of government around the world.
That is funny!

comments.commentBody:
It is a sad and frightening scenario that an outgoing president has to protect information crucial to our nation's security and integrity from the next president. What does that tell you about Trump and his administration?

Our intelligence agencies may be the bulwark in opposition to our democracy being subsumed by the infection which is Putin's Russia.
too hot to handle. this information will go directly from broiler to freezer.

replies.commentBody: Because the Constitution makes no provision to deal with it until proven.
There are plenty of provisions for appointing an independent commission to investigate matters of such gravity. The current administration isn't interested in revealing what actually happened.

comments.commentBody: Why is this current administration allowed to continue with their obstruction and lies? Why is the truth not allowed to come out?  Is it because  the FBI director is in collusion with this administration and GOP legislature?????

replies.commentBody: It would be a low blow with a direct hit if the Obama administration were the only ones who made a Herculean effort to prevent the election of Donald Trump, the Liar in Chief, from taking office.  Why I believe there were far more Republicans making much bigger efforts to take Donald trump down.  You have to be impressed with how successful his gaslighting has been.  As he would say, Sad.  Sad indeed.

John Curley - You don't read any economic news do you? It shows.

This kind of ignorance makes you look foolish.

"The American people spoke, very clearly."

Indeed. Only a minority of those people supported the election of our current President.

comments.commentBody: The Obama administration did everything they could think of to stop Trump, and none of it worked.

replies.commentBody:
"This meme is just a cloud of fluff"

This fluff is just a cloud of meme. Your so-called president won't show his tax returns because (a) he doesn't pay taxes, only the little people pay taxes and (b) they would reveal how deeply in debt he is to Russian oligarchs since American lenders learned their lesson and cut him off.
Lots of things are possible. But the vast majority of them should not be acted upon.
You're perfectly free to remain ignorant of reality if you wish. Many of your fellow citizens want to get to the bottom of this.

comments.commentBody:
This sure seems like a case of sour grapes, gossip & innuendo. Try to get mommy public to stop the mean old bully, Trump.

Who cares if the Russians hacked the DNC? Don't our spooks try to hack them too? If DNC was so lax and flaccid as to allow themselves to be hacked, didn't they, in a way, deserve it? Weren't most of the stories disclosed by Wikileaks true?

Were any votes changed from what citizens cast? So, what's the problem?

What has Trump got to do with it? Even if he tacitly was pleased at the DNC hack, so what?

This meme is just a cloud of fluff, and NYT does itself a disservice by catering to it.

replies.commentBody:
BCP
With Republicans in control they will never do the investigating they should because trump is a republican. If he was a democrat he would have been crucified long ago. Every hear of Benghazi and an email server? They only go after democrats they fear with non issues instead of actually investigating the real threats to our nation.

comments.commentBody: What are our Congressional delegates waiting for? This is outrageous. Time for the truth from the King of Liars, Mr. Trump. Don't let the politicos sweep this under the rug. Show your indignation. Why do you think Mr. T has suddenly softened his approaches to most things...he's running scared.

replies.commentBody: Therefore it's not in the Trump administration's best interest...
Don't really think improper, illegal or corrupt influence bothers either trump or republicans as long as they can push their agendas and get reelected.

"It is in the best interests of Trump, the Republicans and the country to inestigate all aspects of Russian attempts to influence the election."

Obviously Trump and the GOP disagree. Vociferously. I wonder why?

comments.commentBody:
It is in the best interests of Trump, the Republicans and the country to inestigate all aspects of Russian attempts to influence the election. This means looking at ties and contacts with officials of the Russian government, Russian oligarchs and other Russian friendliest.

Not doing a thorough investigation suggests improper, illegal and corrupt influence on Trump and the Republicans by Russia.
Where there's smoke, there's fire.

replies.commentBody: Because the investigations weren't complete, it would compromise sources/mehtods, and would just plain be illegal?  Because two wrongs don't make a right?
If our current President is so concerned about the integrity of our election system, why isn't he backing an independent investigation into all of this?

comments.commentBody: If this intelligence was so valuable, then why didn't the Obama White House leak it to the media immediately?  I'm slipping on sour grapes over here.

replies.commentBody:
This was the Obama administration trying to make sure that the information needed for a proper and thorough investigation of what looks like it might have been illegal and unpatriotic activity on the part of the Trump campaign is preserved. The Obama administration had to do that because the incoming administration, headed by a person who has proven his dishonesty, could have ample reason to prevent a proper and thorough investigation.

And since that administration is in office, it has shown that it will do everything it can to prevent the investigation, and if it goes forward to prevent it from having the data it needs. Thus, the attempts to preserve the data were essential.

No, the point is to find out what happened. Maybe no collusion happened between Trump and/or his campaign and Russia. But the Trump adminstration has fought all efforts to find out what happened. Why? If there is in fact no collusion; why hide it? The question of the possible ties between Trump and Putin /Russia are never going to go away until there is a thorough independent investigation that discloses all: Trumps money interests, his past and present advisors money interests-especially those we already know had ties to Russia. I would think, if innocent, Trump would be eager to clear himself by disclosing his business dealings in Russia or the lack of. But ignoring the whole matter, even with a Republican congress, will not make it go away. There are too many uncomfortable, unaswered questions.

Nancy,

What are you talking about? Did Roosevelt conspire with a foreign power to win the election? Your point is beyond nonsense. You need to learn some history. How can you be so inexcusably stupid? Do you not understand how the English language works? Seriously, your comment is so stupid I don,t know where to being.

comments.commentBody:
I do not understand, was the point to destroy the coming presidency or just to be open and honest all along? Was this like the Hoover administration trying to undermine the Roosevelt presidency before Roosevelt took office?

November 30, 2008

Keep Your Distance
By WILLIAM E. LEUCHTENBURG
I smell smoke.  Can't wait for the fire.

replies.commentBody: There is no comparison whatsoever.

comments.commentBody: This story is beginning to remind me of the Times coverage of WMD that justified going into the 2nd Iraq War.

replies.commentBody: It took 33 years for Deep Throat to be identified as Mark Felt, but in the meantime, Nixon and his co-conspirators were found out and Nixon was impeached. Given Nixon's use of the FBI, it was both prudent and smart to insist on anonymity. And given the recent connections between this White House and the FBI and the attempts by the administration to bury bad news by involving the FBI, current sources have every reason to insist on the same treatment. Information garnered from unnamed sources, when confirmed by a reputable press -- and the NYT is still the gold standard of journalism -- holds tremendous investigative value that will ultimately lead to an unimpeachable case.

Excellent observation and if the late Mark Felt were alive today, he would be saying, 'Follow the money AND the taxes'.

I would love to be in the mind of Carl Bernstein as he eases into a space in an underground car park these days and peers around the pillar!

"We only believe what we want to believe."

The motto of our President's fanatically truth-averse supporters.

comments.commentBody: Unless the NYT publishes the names of these Obama "officials", this article is nothing but fiction. When one considers the obvious political bias of the NYT, there is no reason to give this article any attention.
